snippet: In one of Britain’s most dramatic modern archaeological finds, tests identified the remains of the reviled English monarch, a discovery that could lead to a reassessment of his reign.
abstract: Team of experts at University of Leicester confirm that skeletal remains discovered beneath parking lot in Leicester, England, in 2012 are those of King Richard III, for centuries most reviled of English monarchs; discovery could lead to a reassessment of his reign.

byline.contributor: Alan Cowell contributed reporting from London, and Nicholas Wade from Montclair, N.J.

lead_paragraph: In one of Britain’s most dramatic modern archaeological finds, tests identified the remains of the reviled English monarch, a discovery that could lead to a reassessment of his reign.

headline.seo: Scholars Say Bones Belonged to Richard III
headline.main: Bones Under Parking Lot Belonged to Richard III
headline.print_headline: Skeleton in British Parking Lot Hailed as Richard III
